rules: Rule1: Provided that the suspect is identified as an insider, then it is not the case that the suspect is identified as a drug dealer.
Rule2: Whenever the heist was planned around a gallery event, it follows that the heist was timed to coincide with a security shift.
Rule3: If the heist was planned around a gallery event, then the heist crew used a diversion.
Rule4: Provided that the heist was timed to coincide with a security shift, the heist was executed during a power outage.
Rule5: Whenever the heist was executed during a power outage, the night heist does not hold as occurring during daylight.
Rule6: If the stolen artwork was recovered from a warehouse, then the case is solved.
Rule7: Provided that the stolen artwork was recovered from a hideout, the case is solved.
Rule8: If the police are involved in the investigation, then the police found the stolen artwork.
Rule9: Whenever the police are involved in the investigation, the police obtained evidence.
Rule10: If witness testimony is credible, then whenever the police are involved in the investigation, the police did not find the stolen artwork.
Rule11: Either witness testimony is credible or forensic evidence is reliable.
Rule12: Provided that forensic evidence is reliable, fingerprints match the suspect.
Rule13: Whenever the ruling was appealed, the case was dismissed.

Rule14: Either the conviction was overturned, or the appeal was granted, or if the negation of (either a search warrant was authorized or (if the case is not solved, then the night heist does not hold as occurring during daylight)) does not imply that procedures were not violated concerning rights, then the ruling was appealed.
Rule15: Assuming the heist avoided detection, the night heist did not occur during daylight.
Rule16: Provided that the heist crew used a diversion, they created a distraction.
Rule17: Under the condition that the heist crew created a distraction, the heist avoided detection.
Rule18: If evidence is admissible in court, then provided that suspects were released, they were arrested.
Rule19: Assuming evidence was properly collected, it was contaminated at the crime scene.
Rule20: If the investigation was compromised due to corruption, then it is not the case that the investigation was thorough.
Rule21: In the event that an officer was suspected of misconduct, then if the investigation was compromised due to corruption, the investigation was thorough.
Rule22: Either an officer was suspected of misconduct or an officer was cleared of misconduct.
Rule23: If the police obtained evidence, then the police do not hold as having found the stolen artwork.

Rule24: If internal affairs investigated the allegations, then whenever an officer was cleared of misconduct, it follows that if the investigation was compromised due to corruption, the investigation was thorough.
Rule25: Whenever surveillance detected suspicious activity, surveillance monitored the gallery.
Rule26: Either the suspect is identified as a drug dealer or, if surveillance recorded a license plate, then surveillance detected suspicious activity.
Rule27: If the suspect is identified as an art thief, then it is not the case that the suspect is identified as a drug dealer.
Rule28: Either the suspect is identified as an art thief or the suspect is identified as an insider.
Rule29: If it is not the case that if the heist crew uses a getaway vehicle then the case is solved, then the police are involved in the investigation.
Rule30: Provided that it is not the case that either the stolen artwork was recovered from a warehouse or it was recovered from a hideout, suspects were charged with grand theft.
Rule31: Under the condition that it is not the case that either the stolen artwork was recovered from a warehouse or it was recovered from a hideout, suspects were released.
Rule32: If it is not the case that if suspects were charged with grand theft then they were arrested, then suspects were convicted.

Rule33: Provided that it is not the case that if fingerprints match the suspect then (if the police are involved in the investigation, then the police did not find the stolen artwork), an alibi was verified.

Rule34: If it is not the case that if fingerprints match the suspect then (if the police are involved in the investigation, then the police do not hold as having found the stolen artwork), then an alibi was not verified.

Rule35: Assuming it is not the case that either a search warrant was authorized or (if the case is not solved, then the night heist does not hold as occurring during daylight), procedures were violated concerning rights.

Rule36: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that either a search warrant was authorized or (if the case is not solved, then the night heist does not hold as occurring during daylight) then procedures were not violated concerning rights, then it is not the case that the case was dismissed.
Rule37: Provided that it is not the case that if evidence is not admissible in court then evidence was properly collected, the investigation was compromised due to corruption.
Rule38: If the case is not solved, then the night heist occurred during daylight.
Rule39: Provided that the case is not solved, the heist was planned around a gallery event.
Rule40: If the case is not solved, then surveillance recorded a license plate.
Rule41: If the case is not solved, then surveillance does not hold as having monitored the gallery.
facts: Fact1: The heist crew uses a getaway vehicle.
Fact2: Internal affairs investigated the allegations.
Fact3: It is not the case that suspects were arrested.
Fact5: A search warrant was not authorized.
Fact6: The appeal was not granted.
Fact7: The conviction was not overturned.
Fact8: Evidence was not contaminated at the crime scene.
